Award.AwardTitle: Student Support for 22nd International Symposium on Mathematical Programming; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; 12-17 July 2015

Division.LongName: Div Of Civil, Mechanical, & Manufact Inn

Award.AbstractNarration:
The objective of this award is to provide financial support for students at US institutions to attend the 22nd International Symposium on Mathematical Programming to be held in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, 12-17 July 2015. This symposium is organized every three years by the Mathematical Optimization Society and spans virtually all aspects of mathematical optimization. The goal is to provide partial travel and local expenses support to students who otherwise might not be able to attend.

Successful outcome of this award is that it will provide an opportunity for students to attend an important conference that is held in the US less than 50 percent of the time. The conference is a particularly attractive one, due to the diversity of the covered topics as well as the geographical provenance of the attendees. Students have a strong interest in participating, as very recent and topical research is presented, and the possibility to network with and learn from researchers whose interests are similar to theirs is an important opportunity.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The International Symposium on Mathematical Programming is organized every three years by the Mathematical Optimization Society (MOS, formerly Mathematical Programming Society). This symposium is a central activity of the society and the 22nd edition took place in Pittsburgh (Juy 12-17, 2015; see www.ismp2015.org) and attracted about 1,600 participants. This is a major conference covering virtually all aspects of mathematical optimization.

This is a conference important for students to attend. The aim of this award was to provide financial support for students from US institutions to attend the conference, covering part of their travel expenses and local expenses. Ten grants of $500  were distrinuted. Grantees received also a registration fee waiver for the conference.

 

The conference was held in the Wyndham Hotel in Downtown Pittsburgh. The location in downtown Pittsburgh gave plenty of opportunities for inexpensive lunch and dinner. Downtown Pittsburgh is less than 20 minutes away from Pittsburgh International Airport, with very good public transportation and taxi service.
 
Inexpensive hotels were available close to the conference location with public transportation available. We also had a large number of dorm rooms at Duquesne University (close to the Wyndham) and many grantee took avantage of this opportunity to lower their attendence costs.
